{{cpp/experimental/basic_string_view/title | operator[]}}
{{cpp/experimental/basic_string_view/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl | since=libfund_ts |
constexpr const_reference operator[](size_type pos) const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a const reference to the character at specified location {{tt|pos}}.

No bounds checking is performed: the behavior is undefined if {{c|pos &gt;{{=}} size()}}. 

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | pos | position of the character to return}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Const reference to the requested character

===Exceptions===
Does not throw

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Notes===
Unlike {{lc|std::basic_string::operator[]}}, {{tt|basic_string_view::operator[](size())}} has undefined behavior instead of returning {{tt|CharT()}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;experimental/string_view&gt;
int main()
{
    std::string str = "Exemplar";
    std::experimental::string_view v = str;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; v[2] &lt;&lt; '\n';
//  v[2] = 'y'; // Error: cannot modify through a string view
    str[2] = 'y';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; v[2] &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
e
y
}}
